edu.smith.cs.csc262.coopsh

Class ShellEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.smith.cs.csc262.coopsh.ShellEnvironment

  • public class ShellEnvironment
extends Object
    This represents the state of our shell. The current working directory is a File, and there is a Map of environment variables. "cd" is already implemented, and if you use makeFile(String) instead of creating new File objects directly, it will try to use this current working directory. You will mostly be editing the makeProgram(String, String[]) method.
    Author:
    jfoley

    • Method Detail

      • makeProgram

        public Task makeProgram(String name,
                        String[] args)
        This is the core method of this environment. This is the "exec" system call for our toy OS here.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the program to run.
        args - - the arguments to pass to that program.
        Returns:
        a Task object.

      • makeFile

        public File makeFile(String path)
        This tries to append the string to the current directory if it makes sense...
        Parameters:
        path - - the path the user typed in.
        Returns:
        a file from the local directory or an absolute path depending on whether it starts with a /

      • execute

        public List<Task> execute(String line)
        Don't worry about the implementation here. This parses a subset of shell syntax, and finds the statements separated by pipes.
        Parameters:
        line - a string
        Returns:
        a list of tasks, that were maybe separated by pipes before.

        whenNull - - the backup variable.
